required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention and Treatment of Laryngospasm and Hypoxemia Based on Risk Factors in Adult Outpatients Undergoing EGD
clinical_study.official_title: Development of a Protocol for Prevention and Treatment of Laryngospasm and Other Causes of Hypoxemia Based on Identified Risk Factors in Adult Outpatients Undergoing Esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) Under Monitored Anesthesia Care (MAC)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to identify patient and provider-chosen factors that put patients at risk for the development of hypoxemia (oxygen saturation < 90% for 5 seconds) during endoscopy and to use this knowledge to develop a treatment protocol for specific causes of hypoxemia in adult esophagogastroduodenoscopy outpatients.

primary_outcome.description: Determine if prophylactic suctioning after sedation but prior to introduction of endoscope changes the incidence of laryngospasm during EGDs.

primary_outcome.measure: Identify risk factors for the development of hypoxemia during EGD
primary_outcome.description: These risk factors include both patient factors (ASA class, history of cardiopulmonary disease, BMI, social history, Obstructive Sleep Apnea, STOP-BANG scores and age) and provider-chosen factors (medications given, airway interventions, percent and flow of oxygen in liters per minute, and whether or not the patient was suctioned prior to or during the procedure).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of copious secretions, choking, desaturation, and shortened or aborted procedures
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if prophylactic suctioning after sedation but prior to introduction of endoscope changes the incidence of copious secretions, choking, desaturation, and shortened or aborted procedures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify the various causes of hypoxemia during EGD
secondary_outcome.description: These risk include apnea, hypoventilation, laryngospasm, or other cause of airway obstruction

arm_group.description: This group will be suctioned prophylactically after sedation but prior to introduction of endoscope.
This group will be suctioned by anesthesia providers when clinically indicated by copious secretions, coughing, choking or desaturation.

intervention.description: Suctioned prophylactically when clinically indicated by copious secretions, coughing, choking or desaturatation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over the age of 18 years
- English speaking
- Mentally competent to sign their own consent for treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor incisor teeth stability
- Anticipated procedure of greater than 30 minutes
- History of facial or oral surgery and a baseline oxygen saturation of less than 95% on room air
